      you're screwed. can't google it, you'll only get linked to an automated robot youtube page doing it wrong. and then you'll get blamed for it

9.4.19  5:56 pm   9.4.19  8:29 am   wait, if the rules aren't the same, then how do they change?  and has anyone ever seen them change

      barely anyone has ever been very far off this planet, but they do change a bit when you leave the earth's gravitational field. beyond the bounds of the observable universe they might change quite a bit more, but i'm not sure how or when you'd ever get there

9.4.19  3:36 pm   why is my immune system so much worse than it used to be

      because you are getting older, and weaker

9.4.19  3:31 pm   How do you feel about being asked the same question multiple times?

      pretty good

9.4.19  3:06 pm   What is your favorite video you've uploaded?

      i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite

9.4.19  3:02 pm   hi bill i have a HUGE list of projects and everytime i do a project it seems that i change my mind, for example i wanted to constantly do small projects or projects i wrote a long time ago but i can't find a satisfying way to "attack" my list. everytime i look at it i'm sad because some of the stuff i'm like, "this idea is awesome it should have been done already!". so i'm basically in a phase where i'm blocked and i don't even know why and it's horrible. i know you probably have a big list of song ideas so i wanted to know what's your view on this?

      what helped me was to make a website. i was gonna use tumbler but i couldn't get the settings the way i wanted. so i started using custom settings / custom html. then i realized if i'm doing custom html i might as well make my own site. so i made a site, and i made it just how i wanted it. and i almost flipped over from excitement. then i filled it with everything i had done so far. then there was nothing left to do but to start a rigorous weekly schedule of new content. i had my lists to choose from, but i mandated that i release things 5 times a week according to a certain scheme. this was the result of many months and years of desperation, similar to what you described

9.4.19  3:01 pm   Hey how's your day going?

      pretty good

9.4.19  2:27 pm   will you ever consider letting me out of your basement?

      i have no basement. i'm afraid your story does not make sense

9.4.19  2:14 pm   So a month-and-a-half ago there was a church function at the hotel I work at, there was music and a few of the people had tambourines. After the event they were left behind. A week passed and I said to my boss "if they don't come pick these up I might take them for myself". Fastforward to yesterday and she surprised me with a bag of the 3 tambourines! I had forgotten about them. So I have them in the bag still, saving them for a private function I'll be performing at with a friend in a couple weeks. I got to thinking about the tambourine you're saving for later, is it because you're in an apartment where playing it could possibly be too noisy for current neighbors?

      no, that was a work of fiction, mostly written to suit whatever props i had available

      what i wanna know is why are there no dogs in the musical

9.4.19  2:05 am   I guess you would have to decide this for yourself but if you were recording a live show to produce and sell on the internet, but then you found out that the drum mics were picking up the vocals, other instruments or audience or just basically, there was too much audio bleeding in all the mics, which made it difficult to mix, add effects, compress, etc. You don't have the luxury of having a controlled environment in a live situation.

Would you then re-record the parts? Or would you leave it as is?

Some people would call re-recording, cheating. I don't know if I would call it that.

      everyone does it
